properties.Name: MarketingEventCategory
properties.Description:
A categorization of Marketing Events based on whether they are direct or indirect.

DIRECT MARKETING EVENT
Direct Marketing is one-on-one communication between you and your customer. 

Examples of direct marketing include:

1. Individual communications with your customers or prospects that require them to take action (e.g. direct mail, catalogues, email etc.)

2. Any mass media advertising that requires prospects to take action (e.g. buy, send in for an info pack etc.) and tracks the response (also called Direct Response Advertising) 

Direct marketing has several advantages over traditional advertising methods: 

1.  You choose your target audience, so you can tailor the message to the customer/prospective customer.

2.  You can track the return on investment (ROI) of every ad or promotion, which means you get the maximum return on your marketing budget. You know exactly which promotions aren't working, and which promotions are performing.

3.  You control the communication with your customers. You're able to inform your customers thoroughly about the benefits of your product or service, and build a relationship over time. 

4.  You're able to segment your customer list, and only spend money on marketing to profitable customer segments. 

5.  You can learn from your customers

INDIRECT MARKETING EVENT
Indirect Marketing is aimed at a mass market of customers or prospective customers without any way of knowing via a elicited response whether they have been affected positively.

Columns.Name: MarketingEventCategoryId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Marketing Event Category.

Columns.Name: MarketingEventCategoryName
Columns.Description: The name of a Marketing Event Category.

Columns.Name: MarketingEventCategoryDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Marketing Event Category.
